channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Hiker Rescue; INC#1545; 11:12PM; 1501 N Will Rogers State Park Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/2Vd4NVH; Pacific Palisades; After an exhaustive search by air and ground of all trails in the area, firefighters are unable to located the 3rd missing hiker. The adult male hiker has not be in contact with his family and this incident is now transitioning to a 'missing person' with LAPD in command (anticipating LA Co Sheriff Dept providing ground search personnel). Any questions regarding the ongoing search are referred to LAPD Inc# 4014. No further details.; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 BP23 E23 E269 E290 E69 H4 H7 HA4 HA7 RA69 RH114 T69 T90; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Hiker Rescue - Hoist Op; INC#1545; 02:02PM; 1501 N Will Rogers State Park Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/2Vd4NVH; Pacific Palisades; LAFD Air Ops, in coordination with firefighters on the ground, located 2 of 3 lost but uninjured hikers. Air Ops conducted a hoist operation to retrieve the two hikers and the search continues from both ground and air for the third hiker whom had left the group. The 9-1-1 call was received at 9:10PM. ; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 BP23 E23 E269 E290 E69 H4 H7 HA4 HA7 RA69 RH114 T69 T90; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Trapped Vehicle; INC#0608; 10:42AM; 16500 W Victory Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/45kVbX4; Sepulveda Basin; Multi-vehicle collision with a total of 6 patients including one which required extrication. 1 patient in critical condition, 3 in fair to serious condition and two with minor-non life threatening injuries (two adult males, 2 adult females and 2 children). Five patients from one vehicle and one patient from a 2nd vehicle. 9-1-1 call received at 10:16AM. Questions are referred to LAPD Inc# 1642 West Valley.; FS 100; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC15 E100 E273 E290 E73 E83 E88 E90 EM14 EM15 EM17 HR3 RA100 RA81 RA83 RA860 RA87 RA891 RA896 RA898 RA90 T73 T90 UR88; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1679; 09:28PM; 6103 W Pickford St; MAP: https://bit.ly/45ssWGd; Mid-City; KNOCKDOWN: 18 firefighters extinguished the fire in 13 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire was contained to the kitchen of one unit. No further details.; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E294 E58 E68 RA92 T94; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1679; 09:15PM; 6103 W Pickford St; MAP: https://bit.ly/45ssWGd; Mid-City; Three story, garden style apartment building with fire in one unit on the 3rd floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E294 E58 E68 RA92 T94; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

Brush Fire; INC#1335; 05:41PM; 11950 N Lopez Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; Lake View Terrace; This incident is entirely within the FRA (Federal Responsibility Area) and is an Angeles National Forest incident. The LAFD is on scene as an assisting agency and any ongoing questions are referred to ANF. Initial size up: 5 acres of light grass burning with no structures threatened. ; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 BP74 CM40 CM42 E24 E274 E275 E290 E298 E7 E75 E77 E89 E90 E98 EM15 H2 H3 H7 HA2 HA3 HA7 RA98 T74 T75 T90 T98 WT77; CH5; 18; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0149; 03:14AM; 645 N Gardner St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KCizHD; #Fairfax; Despite dense exterior storage and heavy fire that consumed the attic of the structure, 35 LAFD Firefighters took just 31 minutes (3:45 AM) to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in a one story residential duplex. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 5; AR1 BC5 E227 E229 E261 E27 E41 E52 E61 RA61 T27 T29 T61; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

CONTAINED - Brush Fire; INC#1257; 06:40PM; Cahuenga Peak; MAP: https://bit.ly/3QxxNRW; #HollywoodHills; A series of precise LAFD helicopter water drops have stopped forward progress of the fire at approximately one (1) acre of brush in remote, rugged terrain northwest of Mt. Lee. No injury. No structure threat or damage. LAFD ground crews will remain at scene tonight to complete extinguishment at the perimeter of the burn area to assure final extinguishment. The fire's cause is currently "under active investigation". Though a pair of male hikers were seen on trails near the fire, their specific actions and intent have yet to be determined. They are at this time best described as "persons of interest", rather than suspects.; FS 76; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 AO2 AR1 BC14 BC5 CE83 E227 E260 E27 E278 E290 E56 E60 E76 E8136 E8138 E82 E82C E86 E90 EA1 EM14 H0A H0E H1 H3 H7 HA1 HA3 HA7 RA86 T27 T60 T78 T90 + Burbank FD + LACoFD + Park Rangers; CH7; 14; Brian Humphrey

Train vs Pedestrian Fatality; INC#1343; 06:16PM; 1100 Truman Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rYaFSq; City of #SanFernando; PRELIM: One person (unknown age / gender / affiliation / circumstances) deceased at scene after apparently being struck by (outbound) Metrolink Antelope Valley Line Train #225. Train is still at scene. No other injuries reported. Media Inquiries: San Fernando PD / Metrolink / Medical Examiner. ; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; E75 RA18; CH8; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1257; 05:29PM; Cahuenga Peak; MAP: https://bit.ly/3QxxNRW; #HollywoodHills; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to less than one-quarter (0.25) acre brush burning in remote and rugged terrain northwest of Mt. Lee.; FS 76; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 AO2 BC14 BC5 E227 E260 E27 E278 E60 E76 E82 E86 E90 EM14 H1 H3 H7 HA1 HA3 HA7 T27 T60 T78 + Burbank E15; CH5; 14; Brian Humphrey
